ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
When you first came to our program, were you seen as promptly as you felt necessary?
Notes: 1 = No, it seemed to take forever; 2 = No, there was some delay; 3 = Yes, promptly; 4 = Yes, very promptly

ElementDescription: In general, how satisfied are you with the comfort and attractiveness of our facility?
Notes: 1 = Quite dissatisfied; 2 = Indifferent or mildly dissatisfied; 3 = Mostly satisfied; 4 = Very Satisfied

ElementDescription: Did the characteristics of our building detract from the services you have received?
Notes: 1= Yes, they detracted very much; 2 = Yes, they detracted somewhat; 3 = No, they did not detract much; 4 = No, they did not detract at all

ElementDescription: C: How satisfied are you with the amount of help you have received? P: How satisfied are you with the amount of help your child has received?
Notes: 1 = Quite dissatisfied; 2 = Indifferent or mildly dissatisfied; 3 = Mostly satisfied; 4 = Very satisfied

ElementDescription: Considering your particular needs, how appropriate are the services you have received?
Notes: 1 = Highly inappropriate; 2 = Generally inappropriate; 3 = Generally appropriate; 4 = Highly appropriate

ElementDescription: C:  Has the help you have received helped you to deal more effectively with your problems? P: Has the help your child received helped your child to deal more effectively with his her problems?
Notes: 1 = No, they seemed to make things worse; 2 = No, they really didn't help; 3 = Yes, they helped somewhat; 4 = Yes, they helped a great deal

ElementDescription: When you talked to the person with whom you have worked most closely, how closely did he or she listen to you?
Notes: 1 = Not at all closely; 2 = Not too closely; 3 = Fairly closely; 4 = Very closely

ElementDescription: C: Did you get the kind of help you wanted? P: Did you get the kind of help you wanted for your child?
Notes: 1 = No, definitely not; 2 = No, not really; 3 = Yes, generally; 4 = Yes, definitely;

ElementDescription: Are there other services you need, but have not received?
Notes: 1 = Yes, there definitely were; 2 = Yes, I think there were; 3 = No, I don't think there were; 4 = No, there definitely were not

ElementDescription: How clearly did the person with whom you worked most closely understand your problem and how you felt about it?
Notes: 1 = Very unclearly; 2 = Somewhat unclearly; 3 = Clearly; 4 = Very clearly

ElementDescription: How competent and knowledgeable was the person with whom you have worked closely?
Notes: 1 = Poor abilities at best; 2 = Only of average ability; 3 = Competent and knowledgeable; 4 = Highly competent and knowledgeable

ElementDescription: C: How would you rate the quality of care you have received? P: How would you rate the quality of care your child has received?
Notes: 1 = Poor; 2 = Fair; 3 = Good; 4 = Excellent

ElementDescription: C: In an overall, general sense, how satisfied are you with the help you have received? P: In an overall, general sense, how satisfied are you with the help your child has received?
Notes: 1 = Quite dissatisfied; 2 = Indifferent or mildly dissatisfied; 3 = Mostly satisfied; 4 = Very satisfied

ElementDescription: C: If a friend were in need of similar help, would you recommend the program to him her? P: If a friend's child were in need of similar help, would you recommend the program to him her?
Notes: 1 = No, definitely not; 2 = No, not really; 3 = Yes, generally; 4 = Yes, definitely

ElementDescription: Have the people in our program generally understood the kind of help you wanted?
Notes: 1 = No, they misunderstood almost completely; 2 = No, they seemed to misunderstand; 3 = Yes, they seemed to generally understand;  4 = Yes, they understood almost perfectly

ElementDescription: C: To what extent has the program met your needs? P: To what extent has the program met your child's needs?
Notes: 1 = None of my (child's) needs have been met; 2 = Only a few of my (child's) needs have been met; 3 = Most of my (child's) needs have been met; 4 = Almost all of my (child's) needs have been met

ElementDescription: Have your rights as an individual been respected?
Notes: 1 = No, almost never respected; 2 = No, sometimes not respected; 3 = Yes, generally respected; 4 = Yes, almost always respected

ElementDescription: C: If you were to seek help again, would you come back to our program? P: If you were to seek help again for your child, would you come back to our program?
Notes: 1 = No, definitely not; 2 = No, I don't think so; 3 = Yes, I think so; 4 = Yes, definitely

ElementDescription: Customer Satisfaction Questionnaire total score
Visit name
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2

ElementDescription: To what degree did the treatment program help you to better understand your disorder?
Notes: 1=It was not at all helpful; 2=It was a little helpful; 3=It was quite helpful; 4=It was very helpful; -9=missing

ElementDescription: To what degree did the treatment program help you and your partner support each other through the experience?
Notes: 1=It was not at all helpful; 2=It was a little helpful; 3=It was quite helpful; 4=It was very helpful; -9=missing

ElementDescription: How would you rate the extent to which your partner was included in the treatment program?
Notes: 1=It was not enough; 2=It was just about right; 3=It was too much; -9=missing

ElementDescription: How would you rate the amount of treatment (i.e., number and length of sessions) you received in the program? Please rate based on your overall impression of the service.
Notes: 1=It was not enough; 2=It was just about right; 3=It was too much; -9=missing

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Treatment arm
Notes: e.g., Control, Intervention, Experimental, Placebo

ElementDescription: Please indicate the status of the participant
Notes: 1=Patient; 2=Partner
